para.text: Point objects have only a single vertex. To create a point object, the user does the following:

li.text: The user moves the cursor to the location on one of the views of the model where a point object is desired.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.0; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:avoid; page-break-after:avoid; tabstops:none;
li.text: The user clicks the mouse button. A point object will be created at the cursor location. The

dialog box is used to specify the properties of the object. If the Shift key is held down when clicking with the mouse button and there is a vertex if another visible object within 3 pixels of the point where the mouse was clicked, the point object will be created at the same location as that vertex.

para.text: Typical uses for point objects are to define the elevations of the tops or bottoms of geologic units, and to assign point values for hydraulic properties that will be defined using interpolation, well boundary conditions, and head observations.
